column4: hey, I've got what's probably a stupid question for ya... I've got something that's looking for libmtp, but I've got libmtp9 installed... what's the best way to go about directing it to look for 9?
can I just to a symlink or somethign?
some precompiled binary not from the repos wants an older version?
no, not a precompiled binary
trying to compile, and didn't want to muck with the config file unless I have to
what then exactly?
ahh.. thats. different then
yeah, sorry :)
you may need to compile the older lib also
is there even any possibility that something as simple as a symlink may work?
it may need the older version for a reason. but i guess you could try..
I guess my main question is ... is that a retard option that's going to fubar stuff?
or is it just something that probably won't work?
not that I've found, but probably ought to doublecheck
jmtpfs
trying to get my new android phone to mount
MTP
thought that wes in 12.04
yeah, I tried that first ;)
!pin | killown
pin the old versions basically
Samsung Galaxy SIII
